Congratulations! NIARC 2024
===========================

by [fydamohd](https://fke.utm.my/author/fydamohd/ "Posts by fydamohd")
 | Dec 19, 2024 | [Anouncement](https://fke.utm.my/category/anouncement/)
, [Faculty](https://fke.utm.my/category/faculty/)

![](https://fke.utm.my/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-15-at-11.21.09-AM-980x735.jpeg)

####  ![](https://static.xx.fbcdn.net/images/emoji.php/v9/t36/1/16/1f916.png) **National Instrument Autonomous Robotic Competition 2024** ![](https://static.xx.fbcdn.net/images/emoji.php/v9/t36/1/16/1f916.png)![](https://static.xx.fbcdn.net/images/emoji.php/v9/t8c/1/16/1f389.png)

#### Congratulations! to Universiti Teknologi Malaysia (UTM) for securing the Champion title for the fourth consecutive year in the prestigious National Instruments (NI) Autonomous Robot Competition (NIARC). UTM’s consistent excellence in this competition is a testament to the dedication and hard work of its teams and mentors. Dr. Mohd Saiful Azimi and the Airost team deserve special recognition for their outstanding performance in winning the national champion title once again. Their success exemplifies innovation, teamwork, and technical expertise, solidifying UTM’s position as a leader in autonomous robotics at the national level.

In addition to the champions, congratulations are also extended to Dr. Fauzan and the Sigma team for their impressive achievement in securing the consolation prize and reaching the quarter-finals. Despite not making it to the final stages, their strong performance in the competition demonstrated resilience and determination. Team Sigma’s effort was commendable, showcasing their skills and making a significant impact in the competition.

Also, a big thank you to UTM XCITE and Centre for Artificial Intelligence and Robotics (CAIRO) for providing facilities for student to express their creativity and innovation mind to build the robot. Also, thank you to Faculty of Electrical Engineering for sponsoring the transportation and accomodation to the students.

This achievement underscores UTM’s commitment to fostering talent in the field of robotics and providing a platform for students to showcase their capabilities. The success of both Airost and Sigma reflects the university’s ongoing efforts to stay at the forefront of technological advancements and robotics innovation. As UTM continues to excel in such competitions, it remains an inspiration for other institutions in the pursuit of academic and technical excellence in autonomous systems. Once again, heartfelt congratulations to both teams and their mentors for their remarkable accomplishments in the NI Autonomous Robot Competition.

Author: Nurul Ashikin Abdul-Kadir, Eileen Su Lee Ming, Mohd Saiful Azimi
